raw_text: Two main extensions from that work that we are making use of are: 1) proofs falling below a user defined cost threshold halt the search 2) a simple variable typing system reduces the number of axioms written and the size of the search space (Hobbs et al, 1988, pg 102)
clean_text: Two main extensions from that work that we are making use of are: 1) proofs falling below a user defined cost threshold halt the search 2) a simple variable typing system reduces the number of axioms written and the size of the search space (Hobbs et al, 1988, pg 102).

raw_text: The domain axioms will bind the body variables to their most likely referents during unification with facts, and previously assumed and proven propositions similarly to (Hobbs et al, 1988)
clean_text: The domain axioms will bind the body variables to their most likely referents during unification with facts, and previously assumed and proven propositions similarly to (Hobbs et al, 1988).

raw_text: A third approach, exemplified by Moldovan et al (2003) and Raina et al (2005), is to translate dependency parses into neo-Davidsonian-style quasi logical forms, and to perform weighted abductive theorem proving in the tradition of (Hobbs et al, 1988)
clean_text: A third approach, exemplified by Moldovan et al (2003) and Raina et al (2005), is to translate dependency parses into neo-Davidsonian-style quasi-logical forms, and to perform weighted abductive theorem proving in the tradition of (Hobbs et al, 1988).

raw_text: (Hobbs et al 1988), ?abductive inference is inference to the best explanation?
clean_text: As shown in "Interpretation as Abduction" (Hobbs et al 1988), abductive inference is inference to the best explanation.

citing_paper_authors: Key-Sun, Choi | Jae-Ho, Kim | Masaru, Miyazaki | Jun, Goto | Yeun-Bae, Kim
clean_text: While pursuing the path tracing enabling minimal explanation, now we are going to propose a connectability measure similar such as "weighted abduction" (Hobbs et al 1988).
